com.yantra.ycp.japi.util

Class YCPBaseTaskAgent

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.yantra.ycp.agent.server.YCPAbstractAgent
      • com.yantra.ycp.japi.util.YCPBaseAgent
        • com.yantra.ycp.japi.util.YCPBaseTaskAgent
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.yantra.interop.util.YIFAgentCallback, com.yantra.ycp.agent.server.YCPAgent, com.yantra.ycp.agent.YCPAgentActions, com.yantra.ycp.agent.YCPAgentLiterals

    public abstract class YCPBaseTaskAgent
extends YCPBaseAgent
    Custom Task agent base class. This class needs to be subclassed for writing custom task agents.

    Example:
     package com.custom;
 import org.w3c.dom.*;
 import com.yantra.yfs.japi.*;
 import com.yantra.ycp.japi.util.*;
public class MyCustomTaskAgent extends YCPBaseTaskAgent {
     public Document executeTask(YFSEnvironment env, Document inXML) throws Exception {
        // Custom business logic to process a task record.
        // Throw exception to rollback this task.
     }
 }
    Note:
    1. The input XML to the executeTask method is a XML of Task record for the agent from the Database. Layout of the Task XML is

      <TaskQueue TaskQKey="" TransactionKey="" DataKey="" DataType="" AvailableDate="" Lockid="" Createts="" Modifyts="" Createuserid="" Modifyuserid="" Createprogid="" Modifyprogid="" > <TransactionFilters DocumentParamsKey="" DocumentType="" ProcessType="" ProcessTypeKey="" TransactionId="" TransactionKey="" /> <TaskQueue/>

    2. In the executeTask method to obtain a API handle, use the getLocalApi() method. Do not use the getApi() method.
      For example: - YIFApi oApi = YIFClientFactory.getInstance().getLocalApi();
    3. The agent infrastructure will obtain the tasks for the transaction id setup for this agent. For each task record obtained, the executeTask method will be invoked. The executeTask method can have custom business processing logic to process a task.
    4. To mark the task as completed, invoke the registerProcessCompletion api.
    5. Configuration of a custom task agent is identical to the configuation of a custom agent.
    6. If any exception happens, available date for the task q is updated with fixed interval so that with every run of the agent, the task q is not attempted to be processed again. This interval can be passed to the agent as an criteria parameter 'NextTaskQInterval'. The interval is defaulted to five hours if this argument is not passed. The value passed via this parameter should be a integer. Decimal digits for hours (ex:- 2.5hrs ) are not supported.

    • Method Detail

      • executeTask

        public abstract org.w3c.dom.Document executeTask(YFSEnvironment oEnv,
                                                 org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
                                          throws java.lang.Exception
        Executes a task. This method should be implemented by the classes subclassing this class. This method will have custom business processing logic to handle a task record. The input XML for this method has a element under the root element called "TransactionFilters". This element contains all the input parameters provided to the Agent. oEnv YFSEnvironment - Environment handle. inXML Document containing the Task XML. Exception Exception - if any error while executing task. Null
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        Main method args arguments

      • executeJob

        public final void executeJob(YFSEnvironment env,
                             org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
                      throws java.lang.Exception
        Execute a Job. This method takes a task xml and locks the Task record and then invokes the executeTask method. If executeTask executed sucessfully, the task is commited or if there was a exception thrown, the task record in rolled back. env YFSEnvironment - Environment handle. inXML Task XML
        Specified by:
        executeJob in class YCPBaseAgent
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • getJobs

        public final java.util.List getJobs(YFSEnvironment env,
                                    org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
                             throws java.lang.Exception
        Get tasks for the transaction. This method reads database and returns a list of Task documents for the Transaction Id provided in the input XML. Number of tasks to obtain is based on the "NumRecordsToBuffer" input parameter to the Agent. If left blank or set to 0 (zero), NumRecordsToBuffer defaults to 5000. env YFSEnvironment - Environment handle inXML Input XML to the task agent for getting tasks. Exception Exception if error in obtaining tasks. List of task documents.
        Overrides:
        getJobs in class YCPBaseAgent
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • handlePostRollback

        public final void handlePostRollback(YFSEnvironment env,
                                     org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
        This method is called when any exception takes place while executing the task. This method updates the next available date for the Task record if handlePostRollback executed sucessfully. env YFSEnvironment - Environment handle. inXML Task XML
        Overrides:
        handlePostRollback in class YCPBaseAgent
